Posts.Content: As a rule I don't have a cycle as such as I'm on the implant and haven't noticed any changes up until 5 wks ago. And obviously these are significant changes , Yes The consultant was made aware of my family history which made it even more frustrating to hear him say they wasn't going to do anything else, I definitely think I'm going to get a second opinion, thanks guys xxx
Posts.Title: Invisible lumps??

Posts.Content: Hya everyone I was just wondering if anyone had been diagnosed with b/c but it was initially visible on an ultrasound/mammogram, I've read a few blogs online about this happening to people? Xxx
Posts.Title: Invisible lumps??

Posts.Content: Hya yes I'm planning on going bk to my gp on Monday its still worrying me and still in pain, hope all goes well with ur treatment and good luck with the radiotherapy today xxx

Posts.Content: Thanks Hun, they said I need to be seen in the next 2 weeks so hopefully get some answers soon xxx
Posts.Title: Invisible lumps??

Posts.Content: Hi julia thanks there might be something in that I will definitely talk to my doc about it xxx
Posts.Title: Invisible lumps??

Posts.Content: Hya thanks, no I haven't been diagnosed, I went to the doc around 5 wks ago after finding multiple lumps in my right breast the doc could feel them too I also had some mild pain and aching under my arm pit and upto my collar bone, I was generally feeling unwell and tired all the time, I still have all these symptoms, I also have a family history of b/c and o/c so the doctor sent me to the breast clinic, the consultant could also feel the lumps and they gave me an ultrasound but the couldn't see anything on it, so the consultant just said they were going to leave it at that , but I'm still very concerned xxx sorry my first post was supposed to say "wasn't visible on ultrasound " just noticed I put was instead xx
Posts.Title: Invisible lumps??

Posts.Content: So I went bk to the docs and he agreed I need a second opinion so he's referred me for more tests and also tests for ovarian cancer, symptoms have increased since my first visit so naturally I'm getting even more worried now xxx
